title: Digital Literacy and ICT-Utilized Education: Competency Strengthening Through Hybrid Methodologies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and internet usage experience
context.additional_context: Assumes learners have experience with digital tools but lack systematic educational content development skills. A blended classroom environment combining online surveys and offline workshops.

learning_goals: Learners can concretely explain the three core domains of digital competence: technological utilization, content creation, and critical thinking.
Learners compare and interpret peer learnersâ€™ perceptions of digital competence through survey analysis.
Learners can produce digital educational content (e.g., videos, infographics) using ICT tools for a given topic.
Learners discuss the impact of regional ICT resource disparities on education, referencing African case studies.

resources: Digital Content Creation Tools (e.g., Canva, Camtasia)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
